thread.title: ‘You’re NOT welcome!’ Top eurocrat tells Trump EU envoy pick Malloch to STAY OUT of Europe
thread.title_full: ‘You’re NOT welcome!’ Top eurocrat tells Trump EU envoy pick Malloch to STAY OUT of Europe

title: ‘You’re NOT welcome!’ Top eurocrat tells Trump EU envoy pick Malloch to STAY OUT of Europe

organizations.name: uk protests against president trump tue

text:
‘You’re NOT welcome!’ Top eurocrat tells Trump EU envoy pick Malloch to STAY OUT of Europe ‘You’re NOT welcome!’ Top eurocrat tells Trump EU envoy pick Malloch to STAY OUT of Europe DONALD Trump’s expected pick for EU ambassador Ted Malloch is “not welcome” in Brussels and should stay away, the head of the European Parliament raged today. PUBLISHED: 15:06,  37,   Antonio Tajani said Ted Malloch is 'not welcome' in Brussels 
Italian eurocrat Antonio Tajani said the American professor would not be a suitable ambassador because he had “insulted” the European Union with his critical remarks about the euro and Germany. 
His remarks came as MEPs stepped up a campaign to get the maverick economist declared ‘persona non grata’ in Brussels, meaning he would be barred from entering the EU institutions. Related articles Donald Trump's Brussels envoy pick blasts 'UNDEMOCRATIC' EU 
Prof Malloch has enraged eurocrats by comparing the bloc to the Soviet Union, with Germany at its heart, and suggesting Greece would be better off quitting the single currency and attaching itself to the dollar. 
Several senior eurocrats including EU Commission boss Jean-Claude Juncker have questioned his suitability for an ambassadorial role, but Mr Tajani’s comments are the most forthright to be made by a top Brussels figure. GETTY Prof Malloch is reportedly set to take the role of EU ambassador GETTY Donald Trump has courted controversy with his eurosceptic stance 
Speaking at an ANSA forum in Rome he raged: “We are willing to listen to all advice and criticism, but we are not subjugated to anyone.” 
"We are not willing to accept insults from people who probably do not know the European Union and who the European Parliament has declared not welcome". 
The Italian, who has close links to former prime minister Silvio Berlusconi, also expressed fury at repeated US demands that Europe ups its financial commitment to NATO. We are not willing to accept insults from people who probably do not know the European Union EU parliament president Antonio Tajani 
His country is one of 18 EU member states who together have underspent on defence by an astonishing £530 billion over the last eight years, a recent investigation unearthed. 
But Mr Tajani said: "The US remains a major partner of Europe in the world and we are friends of the United States. 
“But we are not subservient to anybody and we do not take orders from anyone.” The UK Protests Against President Trump Tue, February 21, 2017 President Trump signed an executive order banning immigration to the USA from seven 'muslim' countries. This led to protests across America and, now, the UK. Adam Gray SWNS.com 1 of 18 People gather at the Houses of Parliament in preparation for the Stop Trump protest. 20 February 2017. 
Prof Malloch provoked widespread outrage in Brussels with a recent BBC interview in which he described the EU as “supranational and unelected” and said Mr Juncker should go back to being an “adequate mayor” in Luxembourg. 
Asked why he wanted the EU ambassador post, he replied: “I had in a previous career a diplomatic post where I helped bring down the Soviet Union. So maybe there’s another union that needs a little taming.” 
In response two of the European Parliament’s political heavyweights, Manfred Weber and Guy Verhofstadt, wrote to Mr Juncker and EU Council chief Donald Tusk asking them to block his nomination. Related articles
